metadata.title: CVE-2020-25643 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the HDLC_PPP module of the Linux kernel in versionsbefore 5.9-rc7. Memory corruption and a read overflow is caused by improperinput validation in the ppp_cp_parse_cr function which can cause the systemto crash or cause a denial of service. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as systemavailability.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
